events.originalText: Facing allegations of sexual assault in Sweden, Julian Assange (pictured), the founder of WikiLeaks, requested asylum at the Ecuadorian embassy in London.
events.subtitle: Assange v Swedish Prosecution Authority
events.headline: Julian Assange seeks asylum at Ecuadorian embassy in London amid sexual assault allegations

events.originalText: The royal wedding of Victoria, Crown Princess of Sweden, and Daniel Westling took place in Stockholm Cathedral.
events.subtitle: Wedding of Victoria, Crown Princess of Sweden, and Daniel Westling
events.headline: Victoria, Crown Princess of Sweden, weds Daniel Westling in Stockholm Cathedral

events.originalText: Mass rioting broke out in Shishou, China, over the dubious circumstances surrounding the death of a local chef.
events.subtitle: Shishou incident
events.headline: Mass rioting erupts in Shishou, China over local chef's death

events.originalText: War in Afghanistan: British forces began Operation Panther's Claw, in which more than 350 troops made an aerial assault on Taliban positions in Southern Afghanistan.
events.subtitle: War in Afghanistan (2001–2021)
events.headline: British forces launch Operation Panther's Claw in Southern Afghanistan against Taliban

events.originalText: Only six race cars competed in the United States Grand Prix at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway in Indianapolis, Indiana, after all the Michelin-shod entrants were withdrawn due to safety concerns.
events.subtitle: Auto racing
events.headline: Only six race cars compete in US Grand Prix at Indianapolis Motor Speedway

events.originalText: Basque separatist group ETA detonated a car bomb at the Hipercor shopping centre in Barcelona, killing 21 people and injuring 45 others.
events.subtitle: Basque nationalism
events.headline: ETA car bomb kills 21 at Hipercor shopping centre in Barcelona

events.originalText: The international Patent Cooperation Treaty was signed, providing a unified procedure for filing patent applications to protect inventions in each of its contracting states.
events.subtitle: Patent Cooperation Treaty
events.headline: Patent Cooperation Treaty signed to protect inventions in contracting states

events.originalText: Nguyễn Cao Kỳ, the commander of the South Vietnam Air Force, was appointed prime minister at the head of a military regime.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Cao Kỳ
events.headline: Nguyễn Cao Kỳ appointed prime minister of South Vietnam

events.originalText: Americans Julius and Ethel Rosenberg (pictured) were executed as spies for passing nuclear weapons secrets to the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Julius and Ethel Rosenberg
events.headline: Julius and Ethel Rosenberg executed as spies for passing nuclear secrets to Soviet Union

events.originalText: American baseball player Lou Gehrig was diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, now commonly known in the United States as "Lou Gehrig's Disease".
events.subtitle: Lou Gehrig
events.headline: Lou Gehrig diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

events.originalText: Second French intervention in Mexico: Emperor Maximilian I of Mexico was executed by firing squad in Querétaro City.
events.subtitle: Second French intervention in Mexico
events.headline: Emperor Maximilian I of Mexico executed by firing squad in Querétaro City

events.originalText: The first officially recorded baseball game in U.S. history using modern rules was played in Hoboken, New Jersey, with the "New York Nine" defeating the New York Knickerbockers 23–1.
events.subtitle: Baseball
events.headline: First officially recorded baseball game with modern rules played in Hoboken, New Jersey

events.originalText: The Jesuits' Maryland province contracted to sell 272 slaves to buyers in Louisiana in one of the largest slave sales in American history.
events.subtitle: Jesuits
events.headline: Jesuits' Maryland province sells 272 slaves in one of largest slave sales in American history

events.originalText: The proprietors of King's Chapel, Boston, voted to adopt James Freeman's prayer book, thus establishing the first Unitarian church in the Americas.
events.subtitle: King's Chapel
events.headline: King's Chapel in Boston establishes first Unitarian church in the Americas

events.originalText: An earthquake on the Tibetan Plateau led to the deaths of more than 73,000 people.
events.subtitle: 1718 Tongwei–Gansu earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake on Tibetan Plateau claims over 73,000 lives
